WRITING.TEXT:
On the plus side, we are both fortunate to not only have had disc world shared with us by Terry, he wrote a whole massive pile of disc world books too.
But whilst there's nothing like starting a book for the first time, rereading old books is like meeting up with old friends - always a pleasure.
Ha! That's indeed an apt classification scheme.

Holy shit, that's fantastic - don't think he'd be displeased with that himself.
Happy little trees.

Glad it's been a help to you! the constant hiding can be stressful in itself
I'm fine with my scars around friends, but not work colleagues, or family (no-one in my family knows - at least that I know of). Fine in winter, but wearing long sleeves all through the summer when visiting gets a bit uncomfortable :-| No problem with them seeing tats though :-)

Hey, that's good to know - thanks for sharing :-) Will be interesting to see what some of the local artists say. I can almost see why some scars might not tattoo well - they appear to have an almost shiny appearance from the scarring; I'm glad yours didn't have that problem.
Next step is to find an artist!

That's a good call, having a shared color palette - I like that idea. Should help bring them together.
I probably will end up with a theme for each arm.
Nice one!

Yep, will certainly be going along to see some local artists. From what i've been reading (which is help for me), it can be beneficial to go along to them with a theme, rather than ask for an exact replica of a pic I have. Happy to be lead by them, and as you say they can design something to minimise the visibilty of scars. Ta :-)
Thanks for the feedback :-) I'm looking into local artists and will def. pop in and have a chat with them to help me choose one, and to get some first hand info from them too.
Hurrah, happy to be of help :-)

WRITING.TITLE: Scar covering - lots of scars, varied depth / mixing styles
WRITING.TEXT:
My forearms are [covered in scars](http://imgur.com/gallery/7uioF/new), most minor, few deeper ones, all 10+ years old now. I've been thinking about tattoos on my shoulders lately, but like the idea of sleeves and wandered what effect these scars may have - would they make fine detail unsuitable, and instead be best covered with blocky designs?
A second question, when mulling over designs in my mind, I alternate between fantasy (celtic\mythological\nature), and futuristic (geometric, clean, angular lines); as I can't decide I'm thinking of focusing on one theme per arm. I know it's a very personal exression anyway, but just wanted to get feedback\thoughts from folks who have maybe done something similar - I'm kinda drawn to having one theme and sticking with it, and then I end up perpetually unable to decide one way or the other.
BTW, I've seen a few questions on tattoos and scars when I searched, but many of these have the photos removed now (the posts being several years old), so thought I'd start a new Q, but feel free to link to a previous Q\A if useful.
Thanks!
Can't place it, sounds like a Moby, or William Orbit, instrumental though.
hmm, Choral voices made me thing of [Lakm: Flower Duet](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Qx2lMaMsl8)

I've put together a Spotify playlist, mainly electronic chill type music (Orbital, The Orb, Banco de Gaia etc).
There are also some good Sci fi movie soundtrack compilations on Spotify too; as soundtracks they're all great as background music
Return to the mothership!
What are you 13 and bored? If you have an argument to make, provide sources, otherwise you're just some whining pissant with a big mouth.
Admittedly, it does look cool with incense smoke coming from the ears, which is why I though that too!

Solved!
Nice one, thanks! I've had this curiousity for years and often wondered what it was. Now I know! Not planning on selling it, but interesting to know there are others out there. Looks like mine was attached to the base later on then as the other seems to be without a base.

WRITING.TITLE: Metal (brass?) mini gargoyle head, with hinged lid. About 3" tall, ceramic base. Possibly ashtray? Picked it from a house I lived in years ago.

A pilot, you fucking racist.

That's a shame, I've only heard bits and pieces about the place - seems like it's only just getting sorted 10 years after Katrina. Will do some more research next year though; not sure where we would go there exactly either
Ah, thanks :-) Yep will definitely view the Redwoods in Cali then. Would like to get to NY too, so will bear that in mind too

Visiting next year for 3 week. A few things I definitely want to do:
* monument valley * grand canyon * giant red wood forest (Adironback?) * some driving on route 66, preferably iconic long road disappearing off into the desert distance type scene * breakfast at a diner: bacon and pancakes. Sounds too good * Vegas for 2 days of hedonism
Er, that's it for definite places, but poss also a detour to New Orleans for the music/bars
Damn good work fella, you should be proud of your progress! Pleased for you.

Apocalyptic. No English dialog, so all subtitled (which puts off an unfortunately large amount of people). It's just a good movie, but I like the lack of any known actors, and the risk taken on a non-English script.

It's good to be reminded that whilst producing something amazing is often attributed to innate talent, it is more likely the result of hard work.
Makes it more reachable for folks like you or I - unless, like me, we're allergic to hard work. Damnit.

If nothing else, this campaign seems highly effective at lightening the wallets of many people - ($438,000 donated so far!).
Not one of the scientific source supplied mention their product. This reeks of scam to me, in the same way as diet loss pills (which incidentally, often come with a get out clause of 'may help lose weight when used as part of an overall calorie controlled diet'
In short, as per other responses, look to more tried and trusted methods of weightloss.
Erm...what video?
Hahaha at that comeback though. Worth it.

"The whole experience feels like being in a Bjork video directed by Liberace."
Prizewinning description. Love to see all of these places, very cool.
I'm Harry Potter, bitch!

On a weekend in Scotland some years back, I ended up chatting with an Irish fella who'd gotten drunk the previous night, and fell asleep on a boat down at the harbour, waking up in Scotland.
I presume he was getting drunk once more to try the same tactic getting home again when I met him.

That is super helpful, thanks so much for taking the time to comprehensively answer my questions (including some I didn't realise I had!).
I do have a spare licence of Office 2013, so will have a full version of OneNote to put on there. Good to know about that, and yes hopefully that issue will be fixed soon about which version of OneNote gets launched.
Also I was tentatively considering the Surface 3 purely from a price point. Whilst the 10" isn't ideal, the drawing delay you mention would be a real problem, so really good to know about that.
Sounds the solution you mention of using the native reader and the underlining\adding notes to PDFs would work well for me. I do have an Adobe Creative Cloud licence on my desktop. Not sure if it would allow me to have the full version of Acrobat DC installed on different computer to the rest of my apps, but not a show stopper.
It does sound like you have very similar usage to what I'm expecting - enthused to hear how easy it is to use both PDFs\OneNote together so easily; I've had exactly the same issue with firing up the desktop PC, landscape monitors, mouse navigation, so can really see the advantage of the touchscreen\pen to help with this.
I'm definitely getting one now, at any rate - thanks again for your extremely helpful writeup :-)

WRITING.TITLE: Pre-purchase (SP3 i5) questions
WRITING.TEXT:
I currently use an iPad 2, along with an i5 ultrabook, mainly for studying (notes taking assignment writing, interactive online classes), and had a couple of questions I'm hoping an SP3 owner could answer.
* Using the drawing within OneNote do you have access to commands like snap, to draw joined straight lines easily, or is it mainly freehand drawing? * Is it possible to add notes, or highlight text, in PDFs? I've seen one tutorial video where it seemed that the user was just screenshotting a PDF page, pasting into OneNote and then editing. I'd really like the digital equivalent of highlighting key points, or adding notes, to a printed textbook. As my study books are all available in PDF, I guess this would need to be done through Reader. Just wondered if anyone currently does this.
Thanks in advance!
Btw, my reasons for upgrading are that I rarely use my laptop currently as have a desktop at home, and so would sell my laptop to part fund an SP3. I'd also benefit from the larger (12" vs 10") screensize over my iPad for reading textbooks with.
Also pretty sure that's where Scaramanga had his house in The Man with the Golden Gun
Well that's not very condimentary
Apocalypto. Stunning scenery for a good old revenge story.
Smoke pot, even though it just makes me anxious/uneasy.

I thoroughly enjoyed The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen, and have seen it many times. I only see it mentioned in negative reviews on Reddit, though I think some of its detractors are comparing to the graphic novel (which I've not read) so there may be some reason for the hate.

Attempting, and succeeding, with dangerously perilous climbing...lampposts, scaffolding, trees, buildings. You name it, as soon as I have a moment I'm straight up there, balancing, swinging around, and generally tempting fate.
Been thinking about taking climbing lessons whilst sober to see if the allure is still there ,(and if my fearlessness persists despite lack of Dutch courage)
